title: BoE Member Warns Of Risk If Rate Kept Low
text:

Mon, Aug 17, 2015, 06:43 BST - UK Markets open in 1 hr 17 mins BoE Member Warns Of Risk If Rate Kept Low By (c) Sky News 2015 | Sky News â€“ 32 minutes ago View Photo 

A policymaker at the Bank of England has warned that waiting too long to raise interest rates could damage the economy. 
Writing in the Daily Telegraph, Kristin Forbes said keeping rates at the record low of 0.5% risked undermining the recovery. 
"Maintaining interest rates at the current low levels during an expansion risks creating distortions," she said. 
"Interest rates will need to be increased well before inflation hits our 2 percent target. Waiting too long would risk undermining the recovery, especially if interest rates then need to be increased faster than the gradual path which we expect." 
Ms Forbes, who is part of the committee tasked with setting interest rates, suggested that rates could rise sooner than currently expected. 
She (Munich: SOQ.MU - news ) said that with inflation around zero, there was no need to act before the Bank was confident it was heading back towards 2% within two years as forecast. 
She also said China's yuan devaluation and falling energy and commodity prices meant there was a "bit more time" before inflationary pressures build in Britain, but she would be looking for signs of stronger domestic price pressures. 
The Bank slashed interest rates to 0.5% during the financial crisis in 2009 and has kept them there since.
